meanings.definition: To release (someone) from a mental institution.
meanings.sent1: The hospital is deinstitutionalizing the patients to help them transition back to society.
meanings.sent2: The government is deinstitutionalizing many individuals to improve mental health care.
meanings.sent3: The mental institution decided to start deinstitutionalizing patients by offering community support.
meanings.sent4: She felt like deinstitutionalizing her mind from negative thoughts was a liberating experience.
meanings.sent5: The act of deinstitutionalizing can bring hope and freedom to those in need of a fresh start.

meanings.definition: The process of moving individuals from institutional settings to community-based care.
meanings.sent1: Deinstitutionalizing has led to better integration of individuals into society.
meanings.sent2: The deinstitutionalizing of patients has shown positive outcomes in their well-being.
meanings.sent3: The community celebrated the deinstitutionalizing of their neighbors with a welcoming party.
meanings.sent4: The shift towards deinstitutionalizing has created a more inclusive environment for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The concept of deinstitutionalizing promotes a sense of belonging and support for those in need.
